p: The response of CH 4 fluxes to climate factors was studied by fluctuating 10% of the air temperature, rainfall, and atmospheric CO 2 concentration. As shown in Figure 4, higher air temperature and higher atmospheric CO 2 concentration promote the increase of CH 4 fluxes. This may be because the increase of air temperature is beneficial to the decomposition of soil organic matter and the activity of methanogens [ 7]. Increased atmospheric CO 2 concentration provides more metabolic substrates for methane production [ 9, 10]. The change of annual rainfall has little effect on CH 4 fluxes. With the decrease of rainfall, the CH 4 flux increases slightly.
